summary: This document is an external consultant review of the medical care provided to Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York prior to his death by hanging/suicide. It identifies several process failures, including incomplete tracking of ordered tests, incomplete AED inspection documentation, and recommends adding Health Services staff to psychological review committees. It concludes no medical issues contributed to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose medical care and death by suicide are under review. He was inmate #76318-054 at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Admission to MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was admitted to the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. An EKG and other tests were ordered on this date.

events.title: Epstein's History and Physical Exam
events.description: A History and Physical examination was conducted on Jeffrey Epstein, which the review notes was within the required 14-day policy from his admission on July 6.

events.title: Epstein's Chronic Care Clinic Visit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen at the Chronic Care clinic.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by hanging, ruled a suicide, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: External Consultant Review
events.description: An external consultant completed a review of the medical care related to Jeffrey Epstein's death, finding no medical issues contributed but identifying systemic process failures.

keyFacts: The external medical review concluded that no medical issues contributed to Jeffrey Epstein's death by hanging/suicide.
The review identified a failure to track results for an EKG and other tests ordered for Epstein upon his admission on July 6, 2019, with no follow-up documented.
Documentation for Automated External Defibrillator (AED) inspections at the institution was often incomplete, which is critical life-support equipment.
The consultant clarifies that Epstein's History and Physical on July 9, 2019, was within the 14-day BOP policy requirement from his July 6 admission.
The consultant reiterates a 3-year-old recommendation to add a Health Services staff member to the committee that conducts Psychological Reconstruction Reviews to improve comprehensive patient care.
